item.title: Roblox: Universal Piece Fruit & Weapon Tier List
item.description:
Universal Piece is one of the Roblox representatives of action RPGs based on popular anime. The basis of the world is, of course, One Piece , as you have to explore different islands in the sea. However, you will also find references to other popular series. This applies to the abilities from which you will create builds.

Fruits, like weapons, grant you unique skills necessary for battles. But of course, not all of them are equal in strength and effectiveness. If you don't want to waste time trying out each ability to figure out the best options available to you, this tier list ranks all Universal Piece fruits and weapons to help you make an informed decision.

All Universal Piece Fruits and Weapons, Ranked

As befits the genre, the key role of the build is played by your combat abilities in Universal Piece . Therefore, getting a powerful weapon or fruit will significantly facilitate your exploration of the world, including PvP battles. Fortunately, from the first hours of the game, you can buy the first fruits and weapons by completing quests . But it is worth noting that cheap weapons are useful only in the early stages and no more.

If you want to get the best weapon or fruit in Universal Piece immediately, then you should use the Tier Lists below to guide your journey. All fruits and weapons are ranked, from the most powerful to the least effective.

Universal Piece Fruit Tier List

Best Universal Piece Fruits and Weapons, Explained

All the fruits and weapons are ranked in the Tier Lists above, taking into account their overall effectiveness . In other words, you can still use options from lower tiers if they suit your play style, but at the same time, some Universal Piece fruits and weapons are so overpowered that they cannot be ignored :

  • Monarch Daggers - This weapon has not only the highest damage of all swords, but it also has an impressive range and AoE, which makes it very effective for PvP and PvE.
  • Turbo Exorcist - This fruit is one of the most damaging fruits in this Roblox game, as well as offering flexible moves for various builds.

item.title: 10 Most Influential Games For The Nintendo Switch's Success, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle showcased Nintendo's strong third-party backing and creative collaborations, broadening the Switch's appeal.
  • Ring Fit Adventure innovated with fitness gameplay, expanding the Switch audience and emphasizing Nintendo's hardware creativity.
  • Super Mario Odyssey and Breath of the Wild affirmed the Switch as a successful console with a robust library, avoiding predecessors' pitfalls.

The original Nintendo Switch is one of the most successful consoles in the industry, resetting many expectations of a traditional video game and achieving commercial success matched by few peers. Although its innovative hardware played a major role, much of its popularity comes from the vast game library that attracted fans seeking exclusives and players interested in strong partner support.

Therefore, the games most important to the Nintendo Switch’s success are not necessarily the system’s overall best, but rather those that showed the platform’s potential. While the great majority were developed by Nintendo itself, stronger third-party backing than on previous hardware was equally critical for the Switch to demonstrate its strengths.

10 Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle

Creative Collaboration That Strengthened Third-Party Support

Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle
8 /10
8.0 /10
Released
August 29, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Cartoon Violence, Comic Mischief, Mild Language
Powered by

Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle delivered an unexpected, highly positive surprise on the Switch, pairing Nintendo’s iconic characters with Ubisoft’s Rabbids in a tactical proposal that felt both deep and accessible. The game confirmed the console’s capacity to host creative cross-company collaborations and showed other publishers they could craft innovative, commercially successful exclusives for the platform.

Moreover, the game’s critical and commercial success owed much to its XCOM-style approach, a genre until then rarely explored by Nintendo. Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle reinforced the idea that alliances between major publishers can yield distinct experiences, encouraging fresh concepts, nurturing developer confidence, and further enriching the Switch catalogue with varied, exclusive titles for a global audience eager to test new strategic frontiers.

9 Ring Fit Adventure

Commercial Success And Gameplay Innovation

6 Images
6 Images
Ring Fit Adventure
9 /10
8.0 /10
Released
October 18, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Ring Fit Adventure offers another striking example of Nintendo’s ability to innovate through hardware, delivering an interactive fitness experience that blends classic RPG elements with exercise and sports mechanics. By presenting a unique concept that resonated especially during pandemic isolation, the game significantly widened the Switch audience, appealing to consumers seeking fun, effective ways to stay active within the comfort of home routines.

This success further cemented the Switch as a platform able to reach diverse market segments, reinforcing Nintendo’s longstanding “Blue Ocean” approach. Combining a dedicated accessory with gameplay that remained entertaining yet physically rewarding, Ring Fit Adventure became essential in driving the console beyond its traditional gaming base, proving that fitness and entertainment can thrive together on a single device globally.

8 Splatoon 2

Strengthened Nintendo’s Online Presence

Splatoon 2
8 /10
5.0 /10
Released
July 21, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Cartoon Violence
Powered by

Splatoon 2 proved fundamental during the Switch’s first year, demonstrating Nintendo’s commitment to a robust, persistent online multiplayer experience. Featuring a unique art style and gameplay that merged combat with territory control through ink, the title quickly captured a broad audience, engaging newcomers and dedicated players alike while securing an active community from launch that remained loyal across regular content drops.

The game helped justify the value of the Nintendo Switch Online service by delivering frequent content such as Splatfest events and constant updates that kept players engaged over the long term. Consequently, Splatoon 2 not only reinforced a fresh Nintendo intellectual property but also established the platform as a viable, competitive option for enduring and engaging online experiences worldwide audiences.

7 Doom (2016)

A Technical Milestone For The Nintendo Switch

DOOM
8 /10
8.6 /10
Released
May 13, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

One of the Wii U’s biggest issues was the lack of third-party support, so some uncertainty lingered when the Switch launched. The arrival of Doom (2016) in 2017 marked a genuine technical milestone, proving through Bethesda’s optimization efforts that demanding titles from other platforms could be brought to Nintendo’s portable console without sacrificing the series’ trademark speed and visceral impact.

Even though Doom ran in lower settings than its counterparts, the port let players enjoy the franchise’s frenetic action anywhere, establishing it as a well-executed adaptation. As a true turning point for the console, the game helped dispel the perception that the Switch existed solely for Nintendo titles and demonstrated that ambitious third-party projects could thrive on the system long-term.

6 Stardew Valley

Essential For Indie Success On The Platform

Stardew Valley
65
9.2 /10
Released
February 26, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone (Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Mild Language, Simulated Gambling, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco)
Powered by

Stardew Valley ranks among the most popular indie games ever made, blending traditional farming-simulator mechanics with an engaging cast of characters, and it helped establish the Switch as a premier venue for independent developers. By diversifying the console’s library with high-quality titles that carried more accessible price points than many big releases, the game directly supported the platform’s commercial appeal.

Indie games thus gave the Switch a sturdier catalogue, often delivering experiences that AAA titles left uncovered within their gameplay loops. Coupled with the console’s hybrid format, these qualities granted smaller releases a unique charm, allowing many of them to shine both on a television and during shorter sessions at home or on commutes wherever players happened to be daily.

5 The Witcher 3

One Of The Best Ports The Nintendo Switch Received

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
48
9.4 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

While Doom somewhat opened the doors of the Nintendo Switch to the ambitious ports the console would see over its lifespan, it was The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt that confirmed the system’s ability to host strong third-party releases. Bringing one of the genre’s most expansive and dense RPGs to the hybrid’s modest hardware in fully playable form, complete with DLC, stood as an impressive achievement.

At the same time, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt was never meant to be the definitive version on the Switch, and its graphical and technical constraints compared with other platforms were clear, yet this edition delivered the full adventure of Geralt in portable form, allowing play anywhere. The port therefore underscored the console’s capacity to run games that once seemed impossible on its hardware.

4 Animal Crossing: New Horizons

One Of The Best Cozy Games Is Switch-Exclusive

10 Images
10 Images
Animal Crossing: New Horizons
9 /10
26
8.4 /10
Released
March 20, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Comic Mischief
Powered by

Animal Crossing: New Horizons proved crucial in cementing the image of the Nintendo Switch as a console for all audiences, and its accessible premise dramatically expanded the platform’s user base by attracting casual players and new consumers. Launched when many people needed engaging ways to pass time during the pandemic, the game’s timing further contributed to its strong commercial success.

Wide customization options, a relaxed tempo, and social mechanics made New Horizons a distinctive experience, especially since it could be enjoyed at a different pace, requiring no hour-long sessions but rather short bursts throughout the day. These traits, combined with its visual charm and steady sense of progress, rendered the game ideal for brief, cozy play sessions at home or on the go.

3 Mario Kart 8 Deluxe

The Switch’s Best-Selling Hit

Mario Kart 8 Deluxe
9.3 /10
Released
April 27, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Although the Wii U never matched the popularity of the Nintendo Switch, it did receive strong games such as Mario Kart 8 , whose enhanced version, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe , later became the Switch’s top-selling title, demonstrating the franchise’s enduring appeal. This release showcased the system’s capacity to offer nonstop, energetic competition locally and online, capturing players through its smooth gameplay while highlighting the strengths of cooperative racing on a single screen.

Beyond its phenomenal commercial success, unusual for a remaster, the game fit perfectly within the Switch’s hybrid concept, making it simple to share the thrill even with people unfamiliar with video games. Its gentle learning curve and universal appeal, combined with Joy-Con support, further boosted its popularity and underscored how accessible racing could elevate party play on the platform for families.

2 Super Mario Odyssey

One Of The Mascot’s Finest Adventures

Super Mario Odyssey
10 /10
12
9.6 /10
Released
October 27, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Cartoon Violence, Comic Mischief
Powered by

Released only a few months after the Nintendo Switch reached the market worldwide, Super Mario Odyssey reiterated that developers were pushing the hardware’s limits for first-party titles, signaling confidence in the system’s future. The game displayed Nintendo’s mastery of 3D platform design, providing stages that begged to be explored and inventive gameplay that further refined concepts introduced by previous entries.

The arrival of Super Mario Odyssey and The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild during the console’s early months became the two most important Switch launches because they previewed a robust library. These high-quality releases proved Nintendo had no interest in repeating the Wii U’s missteps, when relevant games took far too long to appear again for eager fans worldwide.

1 The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

The Switch’s First True System Seller

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
10 /10
45
9.2 /10
Released
March 3, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Fantasy Violence, Use of Alcohol, Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Although the game also launched on the Wii U, most of its marketing centered on the Switch edition, making The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild the platform’s first major system seller when it debuted beside the new console. The release also framed Nintendo’s vision for the hardware, presenting extensive freedom and a vast world for exploration to players worldwide.

Even though Breath of the Wild differed radically from earlier entries and broke many series conventions, its changes met with strong approval and set a quality benchmark that future first-party titles had to reach on the Switch. Its popularity and polished gameplay rapidly propelled early console sales, cementing the hardware as a commercial success globally.

item.title: Cookie Clicker: Best Ways To Progress Fast
item.description:
Summary

  • Planning ahead for Ascensions is crucial to avoid wasting runs.
  • Spending Sugar Lumps wisely can propel gameplay forward.
  • Cookie Clicker players should keep an eye out for Golden Cookies to maximize progress.

Cookie Clicker has been the go-to idle game since its release in 2013. Consistently adding new avenues in which players can progress and goading fans of idle games with ever bigger numbers, the giant cookie is irresistibly clickable. However, the early game can feel very slow, and even after ascending multiple times, it can still feel like players are waiting before they can make any kind of progress.

Thankfully, there are several methods that Cookie Clicker players can make use of to speed things up. Here are the best tips for making quick progress in Cookie Clicker , ensuring that players can increase their profits and see the latter parts of the game.

6 Check Ascension Currency Requirements

Plan Next Upgrades Before An Ascension

  • Ascending is a surefire way to increase Cookie production; however, players should make sure they work towards a goal.

Ascending is one of the main ways that players will progress in Cookie Clicker . Players will be given Heavenly Chips to spend on a sprawling tree of upgrades in between runs in the game in exchange for resetting their cookie empire. Most of these upgrades can make a massive difference, thrusting players into the late-game of a run and towards Ascending again much faster.

However, players who have not planned ahead are likely to end up wasting entire runs in the game. To prevent this, players should research which Ascension perks they are aiming for next and ensure that they have enough Heavenly Chips to unlock these upgrades before they go ahead and Ascend. Planning ahead can also give fans a solid idea of when they should be Ascending for the first few times.

5 Spend Sugar Lumps Carefully

Don't Waste The Scarcest Currency In The Game

  • Sugar Lumps are the one currency that cannot be produced at shocking rates in the late-game; players should spend them wisely early on.

Sugar Lumps are usually gained every 24 hours or so, so players are likely to end up waiting a long time to acquire more. During the early stages of the game, spending this rare currency is incredibly important for boosting players forward without having to wait for more. Spending Sugar Lumps on certain buildings can unlock minigames that make for very effective ways to catapult a run ahead to where players will want to Ascend.

Players should spend their first Sugar Lump on the Wizard Tower building to unlock spell casting. They should then proceed to spend Sugar Lumps on the Farm, Bank, and Temple buildings. This will unlock each of the minigames. Then, leveling up Farms to level 9 or Cursors to level 12 will unlock more opportunities to expand Cookie Production.

4 Pay Attention For Golden Cookies

Make Sure To Watch The Screen For These Random Popups

  • While random, Golden Cookies offer such a large bonus that players should always be on the lookout for them.

During their time playing, Cookie Clicker fans are likely to click a few Golden Cookies when they are paying attention. The lucky sweet treats spawn completely randomly, and while their frequency can be increased with certain upgrades, the primary goal if players want to progress faster should be to constantly keep a lookout for Golden Cookies.

Clicking them during the short time that they appear on-screen rewards the player with a temporary bonus: instant cookies, extra cookie per second production for 77 seconds, a click frenzy that increases the value of clicking the cookie, and many other strange bonuses that will produce a lot of cookies early on.

3 Spell Casting

Make Use Of Mana To Maximize Bonuses

  • While all of the spells in the Grimoire look promising, certain spells are better for early progression.

Spending a Sugar Lump on the Wizard Tower building will unlock a selection of spells for players to spend slowly regenerating mana points on. These spells vary in effectiveness, from making 30 minutes worth of cookies, empowering already active buffs, or buying buildings for cheaper.

However, due to the slow regen rate of mana and the potential for spells to backfire, the only spell players should be using regularly is the 'Force the Hand of Fate' spell that summons a Golden Cookie when it is cast. Chaining these spells can stack Golden Cookie bonuses, and the boost that they give can speed players through whole days' worth of cookie production.

2 Use The Stock Market

The Most Complicated Minigame Is A Path To Big Profit

  • While profits from the Stock Market minigame can be very hit-and-miss, players should utilize the system as much as possible.

Leveling up the Bank building with Sugar Lumps will unlock the Stock Market minigame, where players can spend masses of cookies to get stock in cookie ingredients. Getting hold of chocolate, butter, and sugar stock means that players will then have to keep an eye on the status of these products on a graph, watching for when the stock that they hold is worth more.

Players should also watch for stock becoming very cheap and accessible in order to invest in the product and profit when it rises in value again. While it's wise to be careful here, failing to use the stock market is a loss that players during the early-game cannot afford.

1 Make Sure To Prioritize Good Upgrades

Some Upgrades Are Simply Better Than Others

  • Having cookies to spend can often lead to players throwing currency away recklessly. Choosing upgrades that will make the most difference is important.

Often, players will return to Cookie Clicker after visiting another tab or leaving it on overnight to see a wealth of cookies waiting for them. While spending them quickly to get back to making a profit is the natural first impulse, players should instead review each available upgrade to see which is going to be the most effective.

Scrolling over one of their buildings, fans will see what percentage of their cookies per second the building contributes and choosing an upgrade that doubles that CpS of the most productive building will go a lot further than buying 20 of the cheapest building in most instances.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: 8 Best VR Open-World Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • VR gaming is on the rise with impressive open-world titles that offer immersive experiences.
  • Games like Green Hell and No Man's Sky provide unique and engaging gameplay in VR.
  • Modding VR titles like Fallout 4 and Skyrim enhances the immersion, making them must-play experiences.

Virtual reality is a medium that is growing bit by bit in the gaming industry. As VR headsets become more advanced and accessible, it's only a matter of time before this immersive gaming medium becomes a household staple.

Several genres have already made a name for themselves in VR, and it's only a given that players would love to be immersed in a wide-open sandbox where they can explore anywhere and everywhere. The following open-world virtual reality games are perfect for players who want to make the most of their headsets.

8 Green Hell VR

The VR Version Of This Tough Survival Game Is A Blast

Green Hell
8.6 /10
Released
September 5, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Creepy Jar
Publisher(s)
Creepy Jar
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Green Hell is a tough survival game where players are dumped in the Amazon rainforest and must survive by any means necessary. This includes hunting for food, taking preventive measures against infections, finding a place to rest, and fending off predator attacks.

All of this becomes particularly harrowing in VR, making Green Hell one of the harder virtual reality games fans can sink their teeth into. However, the payoff is worth it as players slowly but surely get accustomed to the game's systems.

7 The Forest

The Game Becomes Scarier In VR When Cannibals Come Running Out Of The Dark

The Forest
9.1 /10
Released
April 30, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Endnight Games
Publisher(s)
Endnight Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS4
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Another excellent survival game with VR support is The Forest . The elements of horror in this game are quite effective, especially when players are being hunted down by cannibals in the hostile wilderness.

They must slowly but surely build up a base of operations and develop tools that can help them fend off attacks. As brutal as the early gameplay loop is, players who stick with this game for the long run will love how satisfying it feels when they make meaningful progress.

6 Stormland

Players Explore An Alien World And Engage In Combat

stormland
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 80 /100 Critics Rec: 56%
Released
November 14, 2019
8 /10

Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Players who want to check out a fun open-world game that has a little something for everyone will have a great time with Stormland . Exploration, combat, and puzzle-solving are just a few of the many gameplay loops in this scifi title.

The cherry on top is that this sandbox can also be explored in co-op. The fact that the game's procedural generation switches up missions and locations every week ensures that players will always have an excuse to boot up Stormland whenever they get the chance.

5 Fallout 4 VR

The VR Version Of This Game Is Great And Becomes Better With Mods

Fallout 4 VR
RPG
Shooter
Adventure
Fighting

Released
December 11, 2017
Developer(s)
Bethesda
Publisher(s)
Bethesda
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Fallout 4 VR may have its flaws, but the prospect of checking out this massive open world via the medium of virtual reality is enticing for obvious reasons. Players can always mod the game to iron out its issues and make the experience as immersive as possible.

The end result is a brilliant FPS open-world RPG that is full of beautiful locations to explore. Targeting enemies in an immersive way and looking around to find interesting items will never not be engaging in this generational title.

4 Into The Radius

A Compelling VR Take On The STALKER Series

Into The Radius
7.0 /10
Released
July 20, 2020

Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Players who want to check out a VR game inspired by titles like STALKER will have a great time with Into the Radius . The Pechorsk zone is full of tough encounters and unique anomalies that can change the way they play this game.

It's a surprisingly great title that does justice to STALKER 's mechanics and is perfect for VR gaming aficionados who want to bite down on something substantial. It has its issues, but players who give Into the Radius a shot will be quite pleased by how harrowing and immersive the gameplay can be.

3 No Man's Sky

Exploring Planets And Reaching The Center Of The Galaxy In VR Is A Blast

No Man's Sky
7 /10
49
9.1 /10
Released
August 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Hello Games
Publisher(s)
Hello Games
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

The redemption story of No Man's Sky is amazing and goes to show that games shouldn't be written off despite the issues they have at launch. Players love hopping from one planet to the next as they slowly explore the massive amount of content that has been added over time.

This includes VR support, which makes No Man's Sky possibly the most immersive space exploration game fans can get their hands on right now. Players who want to relax and enjoy the zen exploration loop of this title will have a ton of fun playing No Man's Sky in VR.

2 Subnautica

The Game Becomes Immersive And Scarier Than Ever In Virtual Reality

Subnautica
13
9.2 /10
Released
January 23, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Unknown Worlds Entertainment
Publisher(s)
Gearbox Publishing
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

As horrifying a prospect as it may be to play Subnautica in VR, there's something magical about this experience that fans should not miss out on if they can check out the game via this immersive medium. The original game is already in a class of its own compared to other survival-exploration titles, and VR elevates the fun factor to new heights.

The sinking sense of dread as players venture further from their base and pray that no massive aquatic monster jumpscares them is something that needs to be experienced at least once. If players have been tentative about getting into Subnautica , then the prospect of enjoying one of the most immersive modes released for a video game should be more than enough to convince them.

1 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim VR

Mods Make This Open-World RPG A Blast In VR

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim VR
9.0 /10
Released
November 17, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Bethesda, Bethesda Game Studios
Publisher(s)
Bethesda Softworks
Platform(s)
Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4
Powered by

Skyrim is one of the greatest video games ever made, and the prospect of playing this in VR is too appealing for most players to ignore. While Bethesda's barebones work to port the title to VR should be criticized, things become entirely different when players download and install the most in-demand mods for Skyrim VR .

A decent open-world VR experience turns into one of the most immersive and groundbreaking VR titles that fans can get their hands on. It may be unfair to give Skyrim the top spot based on its mods, but words aren't enough to describe just how ahead of its time Skyrim feels with recommended VR mods compared to most other virtual reality games.

item.title: New World Aeternum Players Can Test Out New 3v3 Arena Map Soon
item.description:
Summary

  • New World: Aeternum launches 3v3 Arena preview from June 17-23, showcasing a larger map with evolving combat.
  • Developers aim to involve players in naming new arena, signaling continued momentum in Season 9.

Starting June 17 and running through June 23, New World: Aeternum players will get a chance to jump into a limited-time preview for the game’s brand-new 3v3 Arena Battlegrounds map. This early test gives a detailed first look at what’s coming next in PvP, offering a solid opportunity to explore the map’s layout, learn its flow, and try out new strategies before it officially goes live in New World: Aeternum .

More than three years after first launching on PC, Amazon’s MMO continues to grow, rebranded as New World: Aeternum alongside its debut on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S in October 2024. Thanks to a steady stream of updates and seasonal content drops, the game has managed to keep things fresh. The latest chapter, Season 8, rolled out on May 13, 2025, bringing in a lot of new content, like additional PvP modes, a full Barbershop system for player customization, and some limited-time events.

As New World: Aeternum Season 8 continues, Amazon is already looking ahead to one of Season 9’s biggest highlights: a brand-new 3v3 Arena Battlegrounds map. According to the developer, this is the largest PvP arena it has created so far, and players will be able to test it during the preview window from June 17 through June 23. The arena draws inspiration from the aesthetic of Monarch’s Bluffs, blending ancient temple ruins with lush natural elements to create a battlefield that feels both beautiful and foreboding.

New World: Aeternum Reveals Larger 3v3 Arena with Evolving Combat

This New World: Aeternum 3v3 arena introduces a significantly expanded layout, nearly 50% larger than existing maps, and features a layered battlefield with elevation shifts, natural cover, and multiple flanking paths. Designed to feel like a long-forgotten discovery rather than a built structure, the environment includes atmospheric details like statues, waterfalls, and weathered ruins, which serve as both visual landmarks and tactical assets. The developers emphasized that combat on this map evolves over time: ranged builds dominate the early game, but as the zone contracts, teams are forced into intense melee skirmishes.

Interestingly, the map doesn’t yet have an official name, as the developers plan to leave that decision to the community through a vote. After kicking off 2025 with a strong New World: Aeternum Season 7 update and following up with solid additions in Season 8, this new arena in Season 9 signals continued momentum. With meaningful content drops and direct player involvement, it’s clear the developers aim to keep both new and returning players invested in the long-term future of the game.
